description: From Middle English underdon, from Old English underdōn (“to put under”), from Proto-Germanic *under + *dōną (“to put”). Equivalent to under- +‎ do. Cognate with German unterthun (“to put under, subject”).

verbs.description: underdo (third-person singular simple present underdoes, present participle underdoing, simple past underdid, past participle underdone)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To do something insufficiently; especially to undercook.
(intransitive) To act below one's abilities; do less than one can.
(intransitive) To do less than is requisite.
